content: I made a small PR a few weeks ago establishing some preliminary stuff that I needed for my proof that the Krull topology is profinite, and @Johan Commelin suggested I should add the rest of the proof, since the big picture wasn't clear. I did this, and the PR is now quite long, so I'm worried it might not get reviewed. Could anyone advise me on how to proceed?
You haven't answered some of my comments but still marked them as resolved. I think answering them would be a good first step.

Yaël Dillies said:

You haven't answered some of my comments but still marked them as resolved. I think answering them would be a good first step.

Oh, I'm sorry! I thought you had addressed those in your big golf commit. I must have misinterpreted that
The first batch yes, but not the second.. That's why I separated them :sweat_smile:
The names are still unsatisfactory. I might have another pass at cleaning up, but I can't really do much about the names because I don't know the maths.
Ohh okay, so I should specifically look at the "deeper comments"?

Yaël Dillies said:

The first batch yes, but not the second.. That's why I separated them :sweat_smile:

For the comment about finset, I'm not sure exactly what you're suggesting. Are you just saying I should rewrite intermediate_field.induction_on_adjoin_finset to use finite sets instead of finsets?
I already did that for you, and changed the name accordingly, but you somehow half reverted the name change so now there are two finite in the name.

Are you talking about the lemma now called adjoin.finite_dimensional_of_finite_set? I renamed it to that because I moved it into intermediate_field.adjoin, and I thought (in my limited understanding of the naming conventions) that this would be the more appropriate name
Yeah. That just means you can't use dot notation on set.finite anymore. And we never call anything finite_set (but you can replace that by finite and it will be fine).
Have also made the names more descriptive
